algebra.title: Algebra
algebra.description: Master variables, expressions, and equations with AI guidance

modules.title: Introduction to Variables
modules.description: Learn what variables represent and how to form basic expressions
learningObjectives: Form simple expressions with addition and subtraction
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about algebraic variables and basic expression formation. Focus on variables as placeholders for unknown values, the difference between numbers and variables, how to translate simple word problems into expressions, and common operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication. Use Socratic questioning to guide students through understanding.

modules.title: Complex Expressions
modules.description: Build multi-step expressions and work with multiple variables
learningObjectives: Work with multiple variables in one expression
Handle unit conversions in algebraic contexts
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about complex algebraic expressions. Focus on building expressions that require multiple operations, working with problems involving multiple unknown quantities, unit conversion within algebraic contexts, and order of operations in expression building.

modules.title: Combining Like Terms
modules.description: Learn to simplify expressions by combining similar terms
learningObjectives: Combine terms with the same variable
Simplify expressions with addition and subtraction
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about simplifying algebraic expressions. Focus on what makes terms 'like' terms (same variable, same power), the distributive property and combining terms, maintaining expression equivalence during simplification, and common mistakes like combining unlike terms.

modules.title: Advanced Simplification
modules.description: Simplify complex expressions with multiple variables and fractions
learningObjectives: Simplify expressions with multiple different variables
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students advanced expression simplification. Focus on working with multiple variables (x, y, z, etc.), fractional coefficients and how to combine them, more complex algebraic manipulations, and checking work by substituting test values.

modules.title: Basic Substitution
modules.description: Learn to evaluate expressions by substituting values for variables
learningObjectives: Understand the relationship between variables and their values
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about evaluating expressions through substitution. Focus on the concept of substitution - replacing variables with actual numbers, order of operations when evaluating, the importance of careful substitution (especially with negatives), and how substitution helps verify algebraic work.

modules.title: Advanced Substitution
modules.description: Master substitution with complex expressions and multiple variables
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students advanced substitution techniques. Focus on the strategic choice of when to simplify vs. when to substitute, working with multiple variables simultaneously, complex expressions requiring careful order of operations, and real-world applications of substitution.

modules.title: One-Step Equations
modules.description: Learn to solve simple equations with one operation
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students to solve basic linear equations. Focus on equations as balanced scales - what you do to one side, do to the other, inverse operations - addition/subtraction, multiplication/division, checking solutions by substituting back into original equation, and building intuition about equation solving.

modules.title: Equation Word Problems
modules.description: Apply equation solving to real-world word problems
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students to apply equation solving to word problems. Focus on reading comprehension - identifying the unknown and relationships, translation skills - turning words into mathematical expressions, problem-solving process - define variable, write equation, solve, check in context, and real-world relevance of algebraic problem solving.

fractions.title: Fractions
fractions.description: Master fraction operations and real-world applications

modules.title: Understanding Fractions
modules.description: Learn what fractions represent and basic concepts
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about basic fraction concepts. Focus on fractions as parts of a whole, numerator and denominator meaning, equivalent fractions, and visual representations using pie charts and number lines.

modules.title: Fraction Operations
modules.description: Master addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of fractions
learningObjectives: Add and subtract fractions with common denominators
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students fraction operations. Focus on finding common denominators, the keep-change-flip method for division, and step-by-step problem solving approaches.

modules.title: Mixed Numbers
modules.description: Work with mixed numbers and improper fractions
learningObjectives: Convert between mixed numbers and improper fractions
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about mixed numbers. Focus on conversion strategies, operations with mixed numbers, and real-world contexts where mixed numbers appear naturally.

modules.title: Real-World Applications
modules.description: Apply fraction skills to solving real-world problems
learningObjectives: Apply fractions to measurement and cooking
Work with fraction concepts in different contexts
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students real-world fraction applications. Focus on problem-solving strategies, connecting fractions to everyday situations, and building confidence in applying fraction skills.

modules.title: Understanding Percentages
modules.description: Learn what percentages represent and basic concepts
learningObjectives: Understand percentage as parts per hundred
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about percentage concepts. Focus on the meaning of 'per cent', visual representations, and common percentages like 25%, 50%, 75%.

modules.title: Converting Between Forms
modules.description: Convert between percentages, decimals, and fractions
learningObjectives: Convert percentages to decimals and fractions
Convert decimals and fractions to percentages
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students format conversion. Focus on the relationship between percentages, decimals, and fractions, and when each form is most useful.

modules.title: Percentage Calculations
modules.description: Calculate percentages of numbers and solve percentage problems
learningObjectives: Find a percentage of a number
Find what percentage one number is of another
Find the whole when given a part and percentage
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students percentage calculations. Focus on the three types of percentage problems and systematic approaches to solving them.

modules.title: Real-World Applications
modules.description: Apply percentage skills to practical situations
learningObjectives: Solve problems involving discounts and sales
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students real-world percentage applications. Focus on consumer math, data interpretation, and building practical life skills.

ratio.title: Ratio & Proportion
ratio.description: Master ratios, rates, and proportional relationships

modules.title: Understanding Ratios
modules.description: Learn what ratios represent and how to write them
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about ratio concepts. Focus on ratios as comparisons between quantities, different ways to write ratios, and real-world examples.

modules.title: Equivalent Ratios
modules.description: Find and create equivalent ratios
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about equivalent ratios. Focus on the concept that ratios represent relationships that can be scaled, and methods for finding equivalent ratios.

modules.title: Solving Proportions
modules.description: Set up and solve proportion equations
learningObjectives: Set up proportions from word problems
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students to solve proportions. Focus on setting up proportions correctly, cross multiplication method, and verifying answers make sense in context.

modules.title: Real-World Applications
modules.description: Apply ratio and proportion skills to practical problems
learningObjectives: Solve problems involving rates and unit rates
Work with scale drawings and maps
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students real-world ratio applications. Focus on unit rates, scaling, recipe adjustments, and other practical uses of proportional thinking.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: Explore shapes, areas, perimeters, and spatial relationships

modules.title: Basic Shapes and Properties
modules.description: Learn about 2D and 3D shapes and their properties
learningObjectives: Understand properties of triangles, quadrilaterals, and circles
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about geometric shapes. Focus on shape identification, properties that define each shape, and real-world examples of geometric shapes.

modules.title: Perimeter and Area
modules.description: Calculate perimeters and areas of common shapes
learningObjectives: Calculate perimeters of rectangles and other shapes
Find areas of rectangles, triangles, and circles
Solve problems involving perimeter and area
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students perimeter and area calculations. Focus on formulas, when to use each measurement, and practical applications.

modules.title: Volume and Surface Area
modules.description: Work with 3D measurements and calculations
learningObjectives: Calculate volumes of cubes and rectangular prisms
Apply volume concepts to real-world problems
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about volume and surface area. Focus on 3D visualization, practical applications, and the difference between volume and surface area.

modules.title: Geometric Reasoning
modules.description: Develop logical thinking about geometric relationships
learningObjectives: Use geometric properties to solve problems
Apply geometric thinking to complex problems
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students geometric reasoning. Focus on logical thinking, making connections between geometric concepts, and problem-solving strategies.

speed.title: Speed & Distance
speed.description: Master time, distance, and speed calculations

modules.title: Understanding Speed
modules.description: Learn what speed represents and common units
learningObjectives: Understand speed as distance per unit time
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about speed concepts. Focus on speed as a rate, different units of measurement, and everyday examples of speed.

modules.title: Time-Distance Relationships
modules.description: Explore how time, distance, and speed relate to each other
learningObjectives: Understand the relationship between time, distance, and speed
Use the speed formula: Speed = Distance รท Time
Rearrange the formula to solve for different variables
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students time-distance-speed relationships. Focus on the fundamental formula, triangle method for remembering relationships, and when to use each form.

modules.title: Speed Calculations
modules.description: Solve problems involving speed, time, and distance
learningObjectives: Calculate speed given distance and time
Find distance given speed and time
Determine time given speed and distance
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students speed calculations. Focus on systematic problem-solving, unit consistency, and checking answers for reasonableness.

modules.title: Real-World Applications
modules.description: Apply speed concepts to practical situations
learningObjectives: Work with average speed over multiple segments
Apply speed concepts to sports and other contexts
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students real-world speed applications. Focus on practical problem-solving, complex scenarios, and connecting math to everyday experiences.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Analyze data, interpret graphs, and understand probability

modules.title: Data Collection and Organization
modules.description: Learn to collect, organize, and present data
learningObjectives: Organize data using tables and lists
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about data collection and organization. Focus on the importance of data in decision-making, different data types, and systematic organization methods.

modules.title: Graphs and Charts
modules.description: Create and interpret various types of graphs
learningObjectives: Create bar graphs, line graphs, and pie charts
Choose appropriate graph types for different data
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about graphs and charts. Focus on when to use each type of graph, how to read and create them, and what stories data visualizations tell.

modules.title: Measures of Central Tendency
modules.description: Calculate and interpret mean, median, and mode
learningObjectives: Understand when each measure is most useful
Interpret measures of central tendency in context
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students about measures of central tendency. Focus on what each measure tells us, when to use each one, and how they help us understand data sets.

modules.title: Probability Basics
modules.description: Understand and calculate basic probability
learningObjectives: Understand probability as likelihood of events
modules.aiPromptContext: You are teaching students basic probability. Focus on probability as a way to quantify uncertainty, using fractions and percentages, and connecting to everyday experiences with chance.
